//: Every spell that a monster casts are explained here. There's no way of telling you the description in-game, and here we are, reading infos about 'em at this file!
//1: Since monsters can only have one spell in their special attacks (and idk if this is intentional to the devs), I tend to combine them... Combo (combination) spell and a regular one, casted in an instance!
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster deals an instant death damage, sacrificing itself upon casting a spell that's been combined with.'
//2: There's a bug in which self-damaging spells are being 'reflected', so we'll use a damaging effect to apply to the caster (the effect requires a turn to apply the damage, and it's a bit unpleasant... but still a backup to prevent overcasting).

description: null... just ignore this.

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster sets itself into guarding stance, blocking physical damage while gaining a burst of speed.'
//: 15 turns duration, to make titans not OP everytime.

description:
Target spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster locks its line of sight onto the target, then casts the Spell(s).'

extra_effects.//: hit_self, so it forces the monster to cast the spell with 0 range value to itself, receiving (de)buff, damage or healing spell effect.

//1: Add an effect to spell. Monster won't cast a spell if it doesn't do anything to the target... I think?.
//2: As long as caster sees the target, it will cast (if its not on cooldown, ofc). Nice.

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

(Combo) spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'A multi-dimensional portal is made from the collapse. This portal leads the carrion race into the world.'

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'After channeling for a massive amount of time, caster's gravitational force field collapses, creating a supernova, dealing tremendous bash damage to all creatures. Sparkling objects are scattered, which enlightens the area.'
//: Basically, an enemy target has to be the center of explosion, so that Spells get casted successfully.
